name: Beef Wellington
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Rub the beef tenderloin with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a large skillet over high heat.
Add the beef tenderloin and sear on all sides until browned.
Remove from the skillet and let cool.
Spread the Dijon mustard evenly over the beef tenderloin.
In the same skillet, add the mushrooms, shallots, and garlic and cook over medium heat until softened.
Stir in the parsley, thyme, and chives.
Spread the mushroom mixture evenly over the prosciutto slices.
Lay the prosciutto slices on a sheet of plastic wrap, overlapping slightly.
Place the beef tenderloin in the center of the prosciutto slices.
Use the plastic wrap to tightly wrap the prosciutto around the beef tenderloin.
Refrigerate the beef tenderloin for 30 minutes.
Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface.
Remove the beef tenderloin from the plastic wrap and place in the center of the puff pastry.
Fold the puff pastry around the beef tenderloin, pressing the seams together to seal.
Beat the egg yolk with the water and brush the puff pastry with the egg wash.
Place the beef Wellington on a baking sheet and bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown and the beef tenderloin is cooked to your liking.
Let the beef Wellington rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Lemon Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Sprinkle the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper.
Dredge the chicken in the flour to coat lightly.
Heat the olive oil in a large oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and keep warm.
Add the wine, lemon juice, and chicken stock to the skillet and cook over high heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has reduced by half.
Remove from the heat and stir in the butter until melted and smooth.
Serve the chicken with the sauce spooned over the top and sprinkled with fresh parsley.

name: Roast Beef Tenderloin
instructions: Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F.
Place the beef on a baking sheet and pat the outside dry with a paper towel.
In a small bowl, combine the mustard, black pepper, kosher salt, rosemary, thyme, and garlic powder.
Spread the mixture evenly over the beef to coat.
Pour the olive oil over the beef and spread to coat.
Roast the beef for 25 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 125 degrees F for medium-rare.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with flaked sea salt.
Allow the beef to rest for 15 minutes before carving.
Serve with roasted vegetables.

name: Roast Beef Tenderloin

name: Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (2 lemons)
1 pound large shrimp (about 16 shrimp), peeled and deveined
instructions: Heat the butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add the salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes and cook for 1 minute.
Add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes or until they turn pink.
Add the lemon zest, lemon juice, and wine and cook for 2 more minutes.
Remove from the heat.
Add the sliced lemon and parsley and toss to combine.
Serve hot with crusty French bread.

name: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: 8 ounces dry cured center cut applewood smoked bacon, diced
2 1/2 pounds chuck beef cut into 1-inch cubes
1 pound carrots, sliced diagonally into 1-inch chunks
1 (750 ml.) bottle good dry red wine such as Cote du Rhone or Pinot Noir
1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves (1/2 teaspoon dried)
4 tablespoons unsalted butter at room temperature, divided
1 pound fresh mushrooms, stems discarded, caps thickly sliced
instructions: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F.
Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven.
Add the bacon and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until crisp.
Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon to a large plate.
Dry the beef cubes with paper towels and then sprinkle them with salt and pepper.
In batches in single layers, sear the beef in the hot oil for 3-5 minutes, turning to brown on all sides.
Remove the seared cubes to the plate with the bacon and continue searing until all the beef is browned.
Toss the carrots and onions, 1 tablespoon of salt and 2 teaspoons of pepper in the fat in the pan and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are lightly browned.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Add the Cognac, stand back, and ignite with a match to burn off the alcohol.
Put the meat and bacon back into the pot with the juices.
Add the bottle of wine plus enough beef broth to almost cover the meat.
Add the tomato paste and thyme.
Bring to a simmer, cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and place it in the

name: Grilled Ribeye with Herb Butter
ingredients: 4 bone-in ribeye steaks, each 1 1/2 inches thick
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 stick unsalted butter, at room temperature
1/4 cup finely chopped mixed fresh herbs, such as parsley, tarragon and chives
instructions: Remove the steaks from the refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling.
Preheat a grill to high.
Brush the steaks on both sides with canola oil and season generously with salt and pepper.
Grill the steaks until golden brown and slightly charred, 4 to 5 minutes.

Turn the steaks over and continue to grill 3 to 5 minutes for medium-rare (an internal temperature of 135 degrees F), 5 to 7 minutes for medium (140 degrees F) or 8 to 10 minutes for medium-well (150 degrees F).
Meanwhile, combine the butter, herbs, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, garlic and cayenne pepper in a bowl and mix well.
Remove the steaks from the grill and let rest for 5 minutes.
Top each steak with a generous spoonful of the herb butter before serving.

name: Grilled Fish Tacos
ingredients: 1 pound skinless mahi mahi or other firm white fish
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush fish with canola oil and sprinkle with ancho powder.
Squeeze lime juice over the fish and season with salt and pepper.
Grill the fish for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.
Remove from the grill and let cool slightly before flaking with a fork.
Grill tortillas for 20 seconds on each side.
To assemble tacos, place some fish on each tortilla and top with shredded cabbage.
In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream, mayonnaise, cilantro, lime juice and cumin.
Spoon the sauce over the tacos and serve immediately.

name: Bobby Flay's Burger
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 hamburger buns, split and lightly toasted
Toppings of your choice (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, etc.)
instructions: Divide the meat into 8 equal portions (about 4 ounces each).
Form each portion loosely into a 3/4-inch-thick burger and make a deep depression in the center with your thumb.
Season both sides of each burger with salt and pepper.
Heat a grill or grill pan to high heat.
Grill the burgers for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your desired degree of doneness.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheese on top of each burger.
Place the burgers on the buns and top with your desired toppings.

name: Roasted Chicken with Roasted Garlic Gravy
ingredients: 1 (4 to 5 pound) whole chicken, giblets removed
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Season the chicken liberally inside and out with salt and pepper.
Stuff the cavity with the lemon halves and half of the thyme, rosemary, and sage.
Tie the legs together with kitchen twine.
Place the chicken on a rack in a roasting pan, breast-side up.
Scatter the garlic and remaining herbs around the chicken.
Drizzle the chicken with the canola oil.
Roast the chicken for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh registers 165 degrees F.
Transfer the chicken to a cutting board and let rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Meanwhile, strain the pan juices into a measuring cup and skim off the fat.
Whisk the flour into the fat in the roasting pan and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Whisk in the chicken stock and the reserved pan juices and cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Season the gravy with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the chicken with the gravy.

name: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: 3 pounds beef chuck, cut into 2-inch cubes
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
In a large Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp.
Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Season the beef with salt and pepper.
Add the olive oil to the Dutch oven and heat over medium-high heat.
Add the beef and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Add the carrot and onion to the Dutch oven and cook until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and cook for 1 minute more.
Add the red wine, beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, and bacon to the Dutch oven and stir to combine.
Return the beef to the Dutch oven and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Cover the Dutch oven and transfer it to the oven.
Cook for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, or until the beef is tender.
In a large sauté pan, melt the butter over medium-high heat.
Add the mushrooms and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the mushrooms to the Dutch oven and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

name: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: 3 pounds beef chuck, cut into 2-inch cubes
2 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
In a large Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp.

name: Coq au Vin
ingredients: 2 chickens, about 2 1/2 to 3 pounds each, cut into 8 pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 tablespoon unsalted butter, at room temperature
1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
Cook the bacon in a large Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp.
Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper.
Dredge them in the flour, shaking off any excess.
In the same Dutch oven, brown the chicken in the bacon fat over medium-high heat.
Remove the chicken and set aside.
Pour off all but 1/4 cup of the fat.
Add the red wine, chicken broth, tomato paste, garlic, thyme, and bay leaf to the Dutch oven.
Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Add the chicken and bacon back to the Dutch oven and cover.
Transfer to the oven and cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through.
In a large sauté pan, melt the butter over medium-high heat.
Add the mushrooms and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the mushrooms to the Dutch oven and stir to combine.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

name: Quiche Lorraine
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the pastry dough into a circle about 1/8-inch thick.
Place the dough into a 9-inch tart pan and trim the edges.
Prick the bottom of the crust all over with a fork.
Line the crust with parchment paper and fill with pie weights or dried beans.
Bake for 15 minutes.
Remove the weights and parchment paper and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until lightly golden brown.
In a large sauté pan, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp.
Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Add the onion to the bacon fat and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let cool slightly.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Add the bacon, onion, and Gruyere cheese to the mixing bowl and stir to combine.
Pour the mixture into the pre-baked crust.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the quiche is set and lightly golden brown.
Let cool slightly before serving.

name: Potato Leek Soup
ingredients: 6 leeks, white and light green parts only, sliced
1 1/2 pounds Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives, for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the leeks and cook until softened, about 10 minutes.
Add the chicken stock and potatoes to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
Remove the pot from the heat and let cool slightly.
Using an immersion blender or working in batches with a regular blender, puree the soup until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Stir in the heavy cream.
Reheat the soup over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot, garnished with chives.

name: Potato Leek Soup
ingredients: 6 leeks, white and light green parts only, sliced

name: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: 2 1/2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 2-inch cubes
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
In a large Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Using a slotted spoon, remove the bacon from the pot and set aside.
In the same pot, brown the beef in batches over medium-high heat, adding olive oil as needed.
Remove the beef and set aside.
Add the carrot and onion to the pot and cook over medium heat until softened.
Add the garlic and cook for an additional minute.
Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute.
Deglaze the pot with the red wine, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pot.
Add the beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf to the pot.
Return the bacon and beef to the pot and bring to a simmer.
Cover the pot and transfer to the oven.
Cook for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, or until the beef is tender.
In a large sauté pan, sauté the mushrooms over medium-high heat until browned.
Add the mushrooms to the pot and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
In a large Dutch oven, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy.

Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot.
